metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16359 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - untriaged.
metadata.Description:
In radare 2.0.1, a pointer wraparound vulnerability exists in store_versioninfo_gnu_verdef() in libr/bin/format/elf/elf.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16359` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libradare2-2.3 - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
libradare2-common - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
radare2 - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: radare2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.0+dfsg-2').
